observations: The output grid has the same dimensions as the input grid.
Non-zero numbers in the input are propagated to other locations in the output.
Each row in the input with a non-zero number will cause other rows in the output to have the same number
Each column in the input with a non-zero number will cause other columns in the output to have the same number
hypotheses: If a row in the input contains a non-zero number, replace every cell in the output row with the same row number.
For each non-zero value in the input, fill all cells in the corresponding row and column of the output with that value.
selected_rule: For each non-zero value in the input, fill all cells in the corresponding row and column of the output with that value.
step_plan: Iterate through each cell in the input grid.
If a cell has a non-zero value, fill all cells in the corresponding row and column of the output grid with that value.
